intro: Dactylorhiza × flixensis, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pale pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it produces a single spike of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Dactylorhiza × flixensis is a perennial herb that plays a role in wetland ecosystems and is often found in areas with standing water.
